newsitem.title: UK: Burton shares hit by resignation reports.
newsitem.headline: Burton shares hit by resignation reports.

text.p: Shares in retailer Burton Group Plc fell on Friday after a report in the Independent newspaper said sales were slowing and chief executive John Hoerner was set to step down.
The shares were two pence weaker at 122-1/4 by 0810 GMT.
"There was a very bearish report in the Independent and that's knocked their share price today," one market-maker said.
The newspaper said Hoerner was a popular figure in the City of London and his departure would be seen as a surprise.
It said his replacement was expected to be Stuart Rose, chief executive of Burton Menswear, Dorothy Perkins, Evans and Principles.
Dealers said the shares had also not been helped by news this week the company would drop out of the FTSE 100 share index from June 23.
